sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Yair Even Or)
articles.description: Taking inspiration from shadows, author Yair Even Or creates the same sort of thing, only with a blurring effect in place of the shadow. Read along for a step-by-step explanation of how it comes together using a combination of masks, gradients, and the good ol’ `backdrop-filter` property.
articles.title: CSS Blurry Shimmer Effect

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Filip Paldia & Jamie Clarke)
articles.description: AI promises a major upheaval in typography, with designers finding themselves navigating both opportunities and challenges. How will it impact quality, design roles, and our use of type in the future? As we explore this new frontier, we realise that we are at a juncture as significant as Gutenberg’s press, set to redefine how we interact with text and visual communication.
articles.title: The AI Dilemma In Graphic Design: Steering Towards Excellence In Typography And Beyond

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Temani Afif)
articles.description: The CSS `border-image` property is one of those properties you undoubtedly know exists but may not have ever reached for. In this article, Temani Afif demonstrates different approaches for using `border-image` to create clever decorative accents and shapes.
articles.title: The Complex But Awesome CSS border-image Property

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: Useful front-end tools for CSS and JavaScript developers that were most popular last year and will help you speed up your development workflow. Let’s dive in!
articles.title: Top Front-End Tools Of 2023

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Atila Fassina)
articles.description: Are you ready for a little exercise of pulling a framework apart and putting the pieces back together? In this article, Atila Fassina explains how meta-frameworks have evolved around core libraries in their own unique ways.
articles.title: SolidStart: A Different Breed Of Meta-Framework

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: The View Transitions API is a new — but game-changing — feature that allows us to do the types of reactive state-based UI and page transitions that have traditionally been exclusive to JavaScript frameworks. In the second half of this mini two-part series, Adrian Bece expands on the demos from the first article to demonstrate how the View Transitions API can be used to transition not just elements between two states but the transition between full views and pages in single-page and multi-page applications.
articles.title: The View Transitions API And Delightful UI Animations (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let’s start into the new year with a little inspiration boost: wallpapers created with love by the community for the community. Happy 2024!
articles.title: The Magic Of New Beginnings (January 2024 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Juan Diego Rodríguez)
articles.description: JavaScript may be the most popular client-side language in the world, but it’s far from perfect and not without its quirks. Juan Diego Rodriguez examines several “absurd” JavaScript eccentricities and explains how they made it into the language as well as how to avoid them in your own code.
articles.title: Making Sense Of “Senseless” JavaScript Features

articles.author: Quincy Larson
articles.description: Beau Carnes has run the freeCodeCamp community YouTube channel for the past 5 years, taking it from 75,000 subscribers all the way up to 9 million. Beau started out working as a Special Education teacher at a Michigan high school. He taught himself how to code before working as a
articles.title: Podcast: Running the Biggest Programming Channel on YouTube with freeCodeCamp's Beau Carnes

articles.author: Sule-Balogun Olanrewaju Ganiu
articles.description: A hash table or hash map, is a data structure that helps with mapping keys to values for highly efficient operations like the lookup, insertion and deletion operations. In this tutorial, you'll learn the following:  * Constant and linear time complexity.  * Why use a hash map?
articles.title: What is a Hash Map? Time Complexity and Two Sum Example

articles.author: Ibrahim Abayomi Ogunbiyi
articles.description: There's a lot of textual information available these days. It ranges from articles to social media posts and research papers. So our ability to distill meaningful insights is key. This helps us make informed decisions in a wide array of contexts.  For example, you can analyze a large volume
articles.title: Natural Language Processing Techniques for Topic Identification – Explained with Examples

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Learning LangChain empowers you to seamlessly integrate advanced language models like GPT-4 into diverse applications, unlocking capabilities in natural language processing and AI-driven applications. We just published a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you how to build six end-to-end projects using LangChain and a variety
articles.title: Learn LangChain and Gen AI by Building 6 Projects

articles.author: Jessica Rose
articles.description: Hello again, I’m Jess. I’ve been running free, online bootcamps around the freeCodeCamp Responsive Web Development and Javascript curricula since 2020.  I’m so excited to update the you all on how this has been going, while reminding you that we’ll be starting a free JavaScript bootcamp [http://badwebsite.club]  focused
articles.title: Free JavaScript Bootcamp for 2024 – Learn JS with the Bad Website Club

articles.author: Esther Christopher
articles.description: CSS units allow you to measure and specify different property values. You use them to modify CSS properties such as margins, padding, height, and width to make them compatible with devices of all screen sizes. CSS units have two basic types:  * Absolute units  * Relative units Absolute
articles.title: CSS Units – When to Use rem, em, px, and More

articles.author: Furkan Emin Can
articles.description: In JavaScript, getting the first element of an array or string is pretty easy. But when it comes to getting the first line of a multiline string, some approaches can hurt your app's performance in certain cases. In this article, we will look at the three best ways you can
articles.title: How to Get the First Line of a Multiline String in JavaScript

articles.author: Matéush
articles.description: In this article, I will walk you through the process of publishing a Next.js application on GitHub Pages.  What makes this guide particularly helpful is that I'll teach you how to integrate with GitHub Actions, too. This means your application will be automatically deployed every time you push code
articles.title: How to Deploy Next.js Apps to Github Pages

articles.author: Natalie Pina
articles.description: According to the 2023 Stack Overflow Developer Survey [https://survey.stackoverflow.co/2023/#section-most-popular-technologies-integrated-development-environment] , Visual Studio Code (also known as VSCode) ranked as the most preferred integrated developer environment (IDE) tool.  Visual Studio Code has many great features out-of-the-box, and supports a large community of extensions to add enhanced functionality.  Stack Overflow
articles.title: Visual Studio Code Extensions to Boost Your Productivity in 2024

articles.author: Alex Tray
articles.description: Microsoft's Azure’s provides many services via a single cloud, which lets them offer one solution for multiple corporate infrastructures. Teams use Azure because they value the opportunity to run SQL databases in the cloud and complete simple operations via the Azure portal.  But you'll need to have a way
articles.title: How to Back Up and Restore Azure SQL Databases
